column4: right now im reading a page that talks about my computer and he was talking about checking the fan drivers (look under etc/rc.d/
now i dont have a rc.d but i do have a rc.Sd which upon opening contains a files one such including sensors
i want to see if my fan cuts on at the right time
yea i havent seen it turn on yet and the laptop under heavy downloads will get hot
you cant see the fan on my case so
you could try in the bios setup - there are often options for power control/fan speed - just to check if you can hear it
i hate to say this but its a powerpc and also i never been in the bios
other than like a regualr desktop
yea and i know about the ppc chat
i figured there is a command you can invoke to test the fan
those are rather hardware specific - so ...
so you might want to tell the channel what kind of notebook you are talking about
#>_<# sry its a ibookg4 ... i use it for school work
any ways the site im reading is talking about install on slackware and he tells you a program to activate the fan anyways is slackware packages very diffrent to debian
I suggest you put your question to the channel again, together with the hardware info (all in one line)
